message: Ok, am I seriously the last person to the sessions and servers party?
I consider myself fairly proficient in Vim, but I'd never heard of these until I came across a reference to `--remote-tab` inside bash-it.
Though I don't find them super compelling given my current use cases; the former I could see myself using some of the time, though usually I just open new files from within the existing vim session
It's still seriously cool that vim has these features at all, though!
I wasn't really aware of these features either.
and the latter, I would likely just use tmux for (other than across reboots)

I still see a case for multiples @nelstrom.  For example, I have tmux running with a bunch of different windows focused on different projects.  I use multiple sessions so each has its own vim with its set of files open.
the vim on ubuntu doesn't seem to come compiled with --servername support. surprised it's not a default option!
do all files associated with a server get sent to the same terminal or can you have multiple terminal windows open with files associated with that vim server? (the latter is like emacs server)
